intro: Psychotria rizalensis, commonly known as the Rizal Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Philippines, specifically found in the mountainous regions of Luzon. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and produces clusters of small, white to greenish-yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests. Psychotria rizalensis is notable for its potential ethnobotanical uses, though further research is needed to fully understand its properties.
